decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize Emry, Lurker of the Loch's ability to cast artifacts from the graveyard to generate powerful combos. The deck focuses on artifacts, with a mix of mana rocks, card draw, and control elements to support the combo strategy. It includes cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Tezzeret the Seeker to further enhance artifact synergies. The deck also includes various tutor cards and countermagic to ensure consistency and protection. The key goal is to assemble artifact combos, such as Paradox Engine and Mana Rocks, to generate infinite mana and card draw, or to establish a lock on the opponent's resources with Winter Orb and Tangle Wire.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a wide range of spells, removal, and counter magic. With Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the commander, the deck aims to take advantage of his ability to draw cards and gain card advantage. The deck includes a variety of versatile spells such as Terminate, Vindicate, Swords to Plowshares, and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats on the board. It also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Dack Fayden to further control the game. By efficiently answering threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck seeks to maintain control of the battlefield and ultimately secure a victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing small, evasive creatures with low mana costs to quickly overwhelm the opponent and draw cards with Edric, Spymaster of Trest's ability. By including a mix of faeries, elves, and other cheap creatures, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain card advantage through card draw and counterspells. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Pithing Needle and Song of the Dryads helps control the opponent's board while allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive strategy. With strong tempo plays and the ability to adapt to various threats, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure victory in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 duel.

The deck revolves around assembling a powerful combo using the commander, Prossh, Skyraider of Kher, to generate a large number of tokens, which can then be sacrificed for various benefits. The deck includes cards that ramp up mana production, tutor for key pieces, and provide ways to generate additional value from sacrificing creatures. It also includes cards that can provide direct damage to opponents or boost the power of the tokens created by Prossh. The goal is to efficiently build up resources and overwhelm opponents with a large army of tokens, backed up by powerful effects that can quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing artifact synergy and a variety of removal spells to disrupt opponents while quickly building up a threatening board presence. The commanders, Silas Renn and Akiri, work well together to support this strategy, with Silas providing recursion for key artifacts and Akiri gaining strength based on the number of artifacts in play. The deck includes a mix of powerful artifacts, card draw engines, and versatile removal spells to maintain control of the battlefield and pressure opponents. By efficiently deploying threats and disrupting opponents, the deck aims to establish dominance early in the game and swiftly close out matches.

The deck revolves around utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the commander to maximize value through a diverse range of two-colored cards. The strategy focuses on control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a wide range of versatile spells like Dovin's Veto, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Supreme Verdict to handle various threats efficiently. Additionally, the deck incorporates a mana base that allows for consistent color fixing and mana ramp to cast Niv-Mizzet Reborn and other powerful spells. Overall, the deck aims to leverage the commander's ability to draw multiple cards and control the game with a well-rounded suite of spells.

This deck revolves around controlling the game by utilizing counterspells, bounce effects, and extra turn spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing its own win condition. With Venser, Shaper Savant as the commander, the deck aims to bounce key threats and disrupt the opponent's board state. Cards like Cryptic Command, Force of Will, and Mystic Confluence provide ample interaction to control the pace of the game. Temporal manipulation spells like Time Warp and Temporal Mastery allow the player to take additional turns, ensuring they stay ahead in resources and tempo. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Promised End and True-Name Nemesis to close out the game once the control is established.

The deck focuses on using Yisan, the Wanderer Bard as the commander to tutor for key creatures and accelerate mana production with elves. The strategy revolves around deploying efficient threats early in the game, such as ramp creatures and utility creatures like Scavenging Ooze and Reclamation Sage. The deck aims to control the board and generate value through creature synergy and card advantage engines like Skullclamp and Sylvan Library. Ultimately, the goal is to assemble a deadly board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth and Hornet Queen. The deck emphasizes consistency and resilience in order to outpace and outvalue the opponent in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 format.
